data.name: Chespin
data.flavorText: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.

data.name: Inkay
data.flavorText: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.

data.name: Furfrou
data.flavorText: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

data.name: Froakie
data.flavorText: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

data.name: Honedge
data.flavorText: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

data.name: Snubbull
data.flavorText: It has an active, playful nature. Many women like to frolic with it because of its affectionate ways.

data.name: Bunnelby
data.flavorText: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.

data.name: Fletchling
data.flavorText: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.

data.name: Swirlix
data.flavorText: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.

data.name: Fennekin
data.flavorText: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.
